intro: Erythrococca usambarica, commonly known as the Usambara redwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountain forests of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, red flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited economic use. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
